definition: to intercede/to plead for sb else
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
variant of 說|说[shuo1]
feeling/emotion/passion/situation

sentences.english: He had occasionally tried to intercede for me.
sentences.chinese: 他有时候也极力为我说情。

sentences.english: She was so unpopular that on one could be found to put in a word for her.
sentences.chinese: 她太不得人心了，没有一个人肯替她说情。

sentences.english: A large number of compromising letters fell into the hands of investigators.
sentences.chinese: 大量的说情信件落入了调查人之手。

sentences.english: The lady said something to get the niggers off.
sentences.chinese: 那位夫人说情让黑人们免于受罚。

sentences.english: He was quickly snubbed when he tried to intercede.
sentences.chinese: 当他试着说情时很快被制止了。

sentences.english: Vegetable Qi seek Yue mama to mention emotion, she certainly must also has homologous movement to just go.
sentences.chinese: 素琪去找岳嬷嬷说情，她当然也得有相应的行动才行。

sentences.english: The friend of God can plead with Him for others.
sentences.chinese: 神的朋友可以为别人说情。

definition: to plea for leniency/to ask for a favor
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
to tell on sb/to complain (to a teacher, a superior etc)/to bring a lawsuit
to appear personally/to step in/to step forth/to show up
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to introduce (sb)/(esp.) to present to the emperor
to exculpate/to absolve/to exonerate
to shield (a miscreant) from punishment, criticism etc/to take sb's side
to shield/to harbor/to cover up
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
to offer an explanation/to plead innocence/to try to defend oneself
to act as go-between (between prospective marriage partners etc)
to be made a scapegoat/to be unjustly blamed
to sound out opinions/to get sb's views by polite or indirect questioning
friendly advice/words spoken on sb's behalf/a good word/kind words/words that sound fine but are not followed up with actions
